itemDescription: British World War I flying ace

wikipedia_page.main:
Flight Lieutenant Robert Leslie Chidlaw-Roberts  (9 May 1896 – 1 June 1989) was a British World War I flying ace credited with ten aerial victories. 
During his aerial combat career, and in different dogfights, he engaged two famous German aces; he was one of the British pilots who downed Werner Voss, and on 9 January 1918, he shot down and killed Max Ritter von Muller.He also served in the Royal Air Force during and after World War II.
